properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be in place this New Year's Eve in Balmain, Rozelle, Birchgrove and Drummoyne in the Balmain Peninsula.

  • From 3pm roads into Balmain East & Birchgrove off Victoria Rd will close including sections of Darling St, Evans St, McKell St, Wharf Rd and other local roads. 

Anzac Bridge citybound lanes and the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed until 1.30am for the midnight fireworks.

There will be no access for general traffic from Victoria Rd into the Balmain Peninsula after 3pm. Access will be maintained for Balmain Access Permit holders on select roads with passes, buses, taxis and other authorised vehicles only.

Roads will reopen from 12:30am on New Year's Day or at the direction of NSW Police when safe to do so. Traffic may be heavy exiting the area so be patient or delay your travel.

Special event clearways are in effect on Victoria Rd between The Crescent and Westbourne St (western side) from 3pm NYE until 2am NYD.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

BALMAIN PENINSULA (BALMAIN/BIRCHGROVE/ROZELLE)

The following roads will be closed to all vehicular traffic entering the Balmain peninsula except Transport for NSW (TfNSW), Buses, Taxis, Hire Cars and Balmain Access Permit holders and will be manned by NSW Police officers. Council has liaised with the police to ensure that taxis will be allowed access to the peninsula on New Years Eve. However, taxi access after 7pm will require the passenger to have information verifying that they are a resident of the Balmain peninsula.

properties.otherAdvice:
With major road closures and parking restrictions in place this New Year's Eve attendees are encouraged to leave the car at home and catch public transport instead.

Roads along the waterfront in Milsons Point, Lavender Bay and Blues Point start closing the night before on Friday 30 December.

On New Year's Eve roads key roads in North Sydney CBD close from 3pm follow by major closures in Milsons Point, Kirribilli and Lavender Bay from 5pm. Roads will reopen by 3am on 1 January.

Key road closure timings:

  • 10pm 26 Dec: Cahill Expressway closed southbound
  • 7pm 30 Dec: Lavender Crescent at Lavender Bay closed
  • 8pm 30 Dec: Olympic Drive and sections of Broughton St in Milsons Point and Kirribilli closed
  • 9pm 30 Dec: Henry Lawson Dr at Blues Point closed
  • 8am 31 Dec: Cahill Expressway closed northbound
  • 3pm 31 Dec: Blue St North Sydney closed. In McMahons Point sections of Blues Point Rd, Warrung St, West Crescent and East Crescent St closed. In Milsons Point, a section of Alfred St South will close.
  • 5pm 31 Dec: major closures in North Sydney and surrounds including Alfred St South, Lavender St, Blues Point Rd, Bay Rd, Union St, Woolcott St, Miller St, Pacific Hwy southbound and surrounding local roads in Milsons Point, Lavender Bay, Waverton and Kirribilli closed
  • 8pm 31 Dec: Pacific Hwy off-ramp to North Sydney from the Sydney Harbour Bridge closed - use the Falcon St exit. Sections of Walker St also closed. 
  • 11pm to 1.30am: Sydney Harbour Bridge closed in both directions including access from Arthur St in North Sydney.

Special event clearways will be in effect on various roads in Kirribilli, Lavender Bay, McMahons Point, Milsons Point and North Sydney between 1pm NYE and 3am NYD. On some streets clearways in Milsons Point, Kirribilli and McMahons Point will be in effect from 7pm 30 Dec.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to speak to an operator and find its new location.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access will be in place as large crowds celebrate New Year's Eve (NYE) in Darling Point.

  • Roads into Darling Point peninsula from New South Head Rd will be closed from 3pm including New Beach Rd and Loftus St.
  • From 6pm sections of Oswald St, Darling Point Rd, Mona Rd, Greenoaks Ave and other local roads will also close. 

Roads will reopen from 2am New Year's Day (NYD) or once crowds have cleared however motorists should expect heavy traffic leaving the area after the midnight fireworks and should travel later to avoid the peak traffic.

Special event clearways will be in effect on New Beach Rd from 8am NYE until 2am NYD.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Motorists are reminded that access into various Eastern Suburb peninsulas will be restricted to local residents only from 3pm. Some areas access is restricted to all vehicle traffic after such time.

Road closures and restricted access arrangements may be in place as large crowds are expected to attend New Year's Eve celebrations at Point Piper.

Road into the Point Piper peninsula may close at the discretion of NSW Police and will reopen after the midnight fireworks on New Year's Day once crowds have cleared however motorists should expect heavy traffic leaving the area after the midnight fireworks and should travel later to avoid the peak traffic.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Cahill Expressway northbound lanes from the Domain Tunnel to the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed from 8am Saturday 31 December 2022 to 4.30am Monday 9 January 2023 for Sydney New Year's Eve and ELEVATE Sydney on the Circular Quay Overpass.

The Cahill Walk shared path will be closed from 8am Sat 31 Dec until 4.30am Mon 9 Jan.

Southbound lanes of the Cahill Expressway will also be closed from 10pm Sunday 26 December until 4.30am Monday 9 January for roadwork.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Harbour Tunnel during the closure period so allow extra travel time.
properties.diversions: Sydney Harbour Tunnel or Sydney CBD via Macquarie St, Bridge St and Grosvenor St to rejoin the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to visit Taronga Zoo during the holiday period between 24 December and 4 January. Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching the Zoo including Military Rd.

When Taronga Zoo car park and surrounding street parking is nearing capacity, the following roads to and from the Zoo will progressively close between 9am and 1pm as required each day:

  • Bradleys Head Rd from Athol Wharf Rd to Whiting Beach Rd
  • Athol Wharf Rd between Bradleys Head Rd and Taronga Zoo Wharf roundabout. 

Traffic controllers will be on site managing parking and traffic flow along Bradleys Head Rd at the Zoo car park.

Access will be maintained for buses and ferry wharf passengers as well as patrons of the Athol Hall Function Centre and the Sydney Harbour National Park.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access will be in place as large crowds celebrate New Year's Eve at Manly Wharf.

Roads around Manly Wharf will be closed from 5pm to 10:30pm including sections of Belgrave St, Eustace St, Gilbert St, Wentworth St, West Promenade, East and West Esplanade and Victoria Pde.

Local access will be maintained for Victoria Pde and Wentworth St residents.

Special event clearways will be in effect on sections of East and West Esplanade, Belgrave St, Pittwater Rd and West Promenade between 1pm and 10pm.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

webLinks.linkText: Parkes Elvis Festival

properties.publicTransport: Visit Parkes Elvis Festival | transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual 5-day Parkes Elvis Festival from Wednesday 4 January to Sunday 8 January. The following roads will be closed to accommodate crowds:

From 6am Wednesday to 8pm Sunday - Short St will be closed from Clarinda St to Welcome St. Motorists are advised that alternative B-Double detours will be in place directing all traffic along May and East Streets, Parkes.

From 6am Wednesday to 7am Sunday - Sections of Clarinda St, Church St and Court St will be closed.

From 6am Saturday to midday Sunday - Sections of Bushman St, Victoria St, and Caledonia St will be closed to facilitate the Elvis Street Parade.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian movement and follow instructions of traffic controllers diverting traffic around closures.

properties.otherAdvice:
The city is no place for cars this New Year’s Eve with significant road closures and parking restrictions in effect across the city, as well as in North Sydney, Milsons Point and Pyrmont. In the Sydney CBD, some roads start closing from as early as 4am with roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks closed by 2pm, followed by major closures in the city centre and Pyrmont by 7pm.

The Sydney Harbour Bridge will be completely closed in both directions from 11pm ahead of the midnight fireworks. The Anzac Bridge citybound lanes will close from 8.30pm to 9.30pm and again from 11pm to 1.30am for both firework displays.

Key road closure timings on New Year’s Eve

  • 12am 30 Dec: roads in the Royal Botanic Garden & Domain including Art Gallery Rd.
  • 4am: Macquarie St north of Bridge St
  • 8am: Cahill Expressway northbound closed until 9 Jan. Cahill Expressway southbound will already be closed from 10pm 26 December until 9 Jan.
  • 12pm: Hickson Rd from Millers Point to Barangaroo.
  • 2pm: roads north of Bridge St at Circular Quay including George St/Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Phillip, Young, Pitt and Loftus Streets, and Upper Fort St at Observatory Hill.
  • 5pm: Railway Colonnade at Central Station
  • 6pm: Wheat Rd at King St Wharf, and Darling Island Rd at Pyrmont. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Walkway and Cycleway will be closed from 6pm to 2am.
  • 7pm: Major roads in the CBD centre between York St and Macquarie St from Circular Quay to Hyde Park, roads in The Rocks including Argyle St, Harrington St, Cumberland St and sections of Hickson Rd, and Pirrama Rd in Pyrmont.
  • After 7pm there will be no access to Harbour St from the Harbour Bridge, use York St or Glebe Off-ramps. For access to Darling Harbour continue via Sussex St.
  • 8pm: Darling Drive from Pyrmont Bridge Rd to Pier St
  • 8.30pm - 9.30pm: citybound lanes on the Anzac Bridge and Western Distributor
  • 10pm: roads in Millers Point including sections of Kent St, Windmill St, Argyle St and Lower Fort St, and roads between Wynyard and Town Hall including sections of York St and Clarence St between Margaret St and Druitt St.
  • 11pm - 1.30am: Sydney Harbour Bridge closed in both directions, Anzac Bridge closed citybound, and Western Distributor closed between Pyrmont and the city. Roads in CBD West also closed including Sussex St and Kent St, and all roads in King St Wharf. Additional closures in CBD South around Hyde Park including sections of Liverpool, Pitt, Castlereagh and Elizabeth Streets, sections of roads around Central station also closed.

Most roads in the city reopen between 1.30am and 4am on New Year's Day.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on most major roads throughout the Sydney CBD and Pyrmont from 6am on NYE until 4am on NYD. These clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

These clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. properties.otherAdvice:
Test Match Cricket series – Australia v South Africa at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Gates Open approx 8:30am each morning. Finish approx 5:30pm each evening.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd for the five days of test cricket at The SCG.

Driver Avenue will close from 5:30am on Wednesday 4 January and will re-open at 9pm on Saturday 7 January. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue, however access to EP2 will be maintained via Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Road.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park on sections of Moore Park Road, Lang Road, Fitzroy Street, Albion Street, Flinders Street and Foveaux Street from 7am to 7pm on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday and Sunday. These clearways will extend to 8pm on Saturday 7 January. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Up to 25,000 people are expected to attend the annual Falls Festival North Byron Bay Parklands from 31 December until 2 January. 

Traffic is expected to be heavy on roads approaching the festival site each day throughout the festival, particularly from Sunday as festival goers make their way to the campsite. Traffic will be heavy on Brunswick Valley Way, Tweed Valley Way and Pacific Mwy. 

Traffic will also be heavy on Monday 2 and Tuesday 3 January as festival-goers leave Byron Bay.

Motorists travelling in the area should expect delays and allow extra travel time.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual country music festival in Tamworth from Friday 13 January until Sunday 22 January.

Road closures will be in place for the event between Saturday 7 January and Tuesday 24 January to accommodate the event, as follows:

  • Peel St between White St and Brisbane St closed from 4am Thursday 12 January until 7pm Monday 23 January
  • Fitzroy St between Smith Pl egress and Peel St closed from 5am Tuesday 10 January until 7pm Tuesday 24 January
  • Fitzroy St between Peel St and Kable Ave closed from 11pm Saturday 7 January until 7pm on Tuesday 24 January

Motorists travelling in the area during the festival should be aware of changed access conditions and follow the direction of traffic controllers and police on site. Motorists may experience minor delays on highways in the area.

webLinks.linkText: NSW National Parks & Wildlife Service - Royal National Park local alerts

properties.otherAdvice:
The Royal National Park is expected to be busy over the Christmas and New year holiday period between 24 December and 2 January.

Road closures will be implemented as precincts and car parks reach full at Wattamolla Beach, Garie Beach, Audley, Maianbar and Bundeena.

If parking capacity is reached across all precincts, traffic will only be permitted to travel through the park. If there are significant delays, both the northern and southern entries to the park via Farnell Ave at Loftus and via Lady Wakehurst Dr at Otford will close. Entry will be maintained via McKell Ave at Waterfall for residents only. 

Visitors are encouraged to check the Royal National Park local alerts before travelling for updates on precinct access. Walking trails may also be closed due to fire bans and/or risks so plan ahead. 

Road closures when precincts reach capacity:

  • Wattamolla Car Park is Closed (Wattamolla Rd between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Wattamolla Beach)
  • Maianbar Rd between Bundeena Dr and Maianbar township
  • Bundeena Dr between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Bundeena township

Traffic controllers and NSW Police will be on-site managing access for local residents on Maianbar Rd and Bundeena Dr upon proof of residential address.

Garie Road from Sir Bertram Stevens Drive is closed.
properties.displayName: Royal National Park - Christmas & New Year holiday period

roads.mainStreet: McKell Ave, Farnell Ave and various roads
